name: code-dimmer
description: Highlights the block containing the cursor, dims other text. Forked from VSCode Dimmer Block

dimmer.enabled.description: When set to true, the extension will dim non-selected text.

dimmer.toggleDimmerCommandScope.description: Decides whether the `ToggleDimmer` command will affect the user (global) or workspace (local) settings.

dimmer.opacity.description: An integer between 0 and 100 used for the opacity percentage for the dimmed (non-selected) text.

dimmer.delay.description: Delay in milliseconds for dimming the non-selected text to reduce number of API calls in the event of rapid selection changes. Defaults to 0, but set higher if it feels like it is causing problems.

dimmer.dimmingReason.description: Decides what will trigger the dimming of non-selected text.
